The question is not logically coherent. No theological teaching proposes either that: (A) You have no freedom of choice or (B) That the wisdom of Jesus Christ is imposed upon you. The inquiry does not show a direct relationship between Jesus Christ and yourself. If you pride yourself on what you refer to as “own wisdom” that is your option. Of course, what you refer to as your “own wisdom” has not objectively been shown to affect mankind and human history for 2,000 years either. Moreover, your “own wisdom” is neither identified objectively nor published.

Good question. I guess that a person's wisdom is a function of his/her intelligence and experience informed and guided by his/her moral compass. So it must be perfectly natural and right to rely on your own wisdom but, equally, another person's wisdom can have something to offer, as it cooked up from different ingredients from yours.
